intro: Gnidia pentandra, commonly known as the red-stemmed gnidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its distinctive red stems and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature, containing several seeds. Gnidia pentandra is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
